pullRequest.body:
Introduces the Upper Set topology, which is the canonical example of an Alexandrov topology and its dual, the Lower Set topology.

---

An Alexandrov topology is a topology where the intersection of any collection of open sets is open. The `UpperSetTopology` is an Alexandrov topology, and, given any Alexandrov topology, a `Preorder` may be defined on the underlying set such that the `UpperSetTopology` of the `Preorder` coincides with the original topology.

However, our motivation for introducing the `UpperSetTopology` is its use in the construction of the Scott Topology (#2508). Beyond demonstrating that the set of open sets is closed under arbitrary intersections, we have not sought to further develop the theory of Alexandrov topologies in this PR. However, we hope that by breaking the Upper Set topology out into a separate file / PR, we may facilitate anyone who does wish to develop mathlib4 in that direction.

See also the discussion about naming [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Possible.20future.20name.20collision)

For completeness we also introduce the dual Lower Set topology.

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #5873
- [x] depends on: #6157

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Could you add comments (I'd say both in the module docstrings and in the docs of the definitions) warning that this is not the dual of the `LowerTopology`? Maybe even add an example in the module docstring.

> Could you add comments (I'd say both in the module docstrings and in the docs of the definitions) warning that this is not the dual of the `LowerTopology`? Maybe even add an example in the module docstring.

I've added the warning and also `UpperSetTopology.Monotone_to_LowerTopology_Dual_Continuous` which explains the relationship between these topologies.

I think I know your answer, but why not also introduce `LowerSetTopology`? In particular I feel like having the full collection would make it easier to emphasize that `LowerTopology` is different from `LowerSetTopoloy`, without resorting to dualizing the order.
I don't have a use case in mind, but I know that I have a use case for the dual version of `LowerTopology` (which we still don't have) so it wouldn't surprise me if such a case appears in the future.

> I think I know your answer, but why not also introduce `LowerSetTopology`? In particular I feel like having the full collection would make it easier to emphasize that `LowerTopology` is different from `LowerSetTopoloy`, without resorting to dualizing the order. I don't have a use case in mind, but I know that I have a use case for the dual version of `LowerTopology` (which we still don't have) so it wouldn't surprise me if such a case appears in the future.

I got my fingers burnt early on introducing something just because we could which then caused trouble later on, so I've been a bit cautious since. If you have a use for `UpperTopology` (the dual version of `LowerTopology`) then maybe we should just go ahead and add these things in.

Would I just create a file called `LowerSetTopology.lean`, define
```
def lowerSetTopology : TopologicalSpace Î± :=
{ IsOpen := IsLowerSet,
...
```
and restate/prove all the results, or can I infer them all somehow using `OrderDual`?

> > I think I know your answer, but why not also introduce `LowerSetTopology`? In particular I feel like having the full collection would make it easier to emphasize that `LowerTopology` is different from `LowerSetTopoloy`, without resorting to dualizing the order. I don't have a use case in mind, but I know that I have a use case for the dual version of `LowerTopology` (which we still don't have) so it wouldn't surprise me if such a case appears in the future.
> 
> I got my fingers burnt early on introducing something just because we could which then caused trouble later on, so I've been a bit cautious since. If you have a use for `UpperTopology` (the dual version of `LowerTopology`) then maybe we should just go ahead and add these things in.
> 
> Would I just create a file called `LowerSetTopology.lean`, define
> 
> ```
> def lowerSetTopology : TopologicalSpace Î± :=
> { IsOpen := IsLowerSet,
> ...
> ```
> 
> and restate/prove all the results, or can I infer them all somehow using `OrderDual`?

I'd say you can have them in the same file (`UpperLowerSetTopology.lean`). You can either separate them into two sections or mix them, it doesn't really matter (except maybe for managing namespaces). You'll have to restate all the results, but the proofs should hopefully be one line applications of the upper version

> I'd say you can have them in the same file (`UpperLowerSetTopology.lean`). You can either separate them into two sections or mix them, it doesn't really matter (except maybe for managing namespaces). You'll have to restate all the results, but the proofs should hopefully be one line applications of the upper version

I've made a start on adding `UpperTopology`: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/mans0954/UpperTopology

I've added `def toOrderDualHomeomorph [Preorder Î±] : WithLowerTopology Î± â‰ƒâ‚œ WithUpperTopology Î±áµ’áµˆ` - is that the right way to express this?

> I've made a start on adding `UpperTopology`: [`mans0954`/UpperTopology](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/mans0954/UpperTopology?rgh-link-date=2023-07-12T07%3A52%3A57Z)
> 
> I've added `def toOrderDualHomeomorph [Preorder Î±] : WithLowerTopology Î± â‰ƒâ‚œ WithUpperTopology Î±áµ’áµˆ` - is that the right way to express this?

Could you please open a PR for that? It'll be easier to make suggestions. Also if you want to dualize this particular file in a separate PR that would work for me, do as you wish.

@ADedecker I've added the statements for the lower set topology to this file/PR.

Is the next step to prove:
```
instance  [Preorder Î±] [TopologicalSpace Î±] [LowerSetTopology Î±] : UpperSetTopology (Î±áµ’áµˆ) := sorry
```
so that
```
theorem LowerSetTopology.IsOpen_sInter {S : Set (Set Î±)} (hf : âˆ€ s âˆˆ S, IsOpen s) : IsOpen (â‹‚â‚€ S) := by
  apply @UpperSetTopology.IsOpen_sInter Î±áµ’áµˆ _ _ _ _ (fun s a â†¦ hf s a)
```
etc?

Yes, I think this is the perfect approach! In particular note that you don't actually need an homeomorphism with the order dual, this instance does all the work.

EDIT: you can keep the homeomorphism of course, I just meant that you don't have to manually transport all the proofs through it.
Could you merge master?

> Could you merge master?

Done.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#5873~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#6157~~

  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5730357027/job/15528968042)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5730357027/job/15528968453)

Final set of nitpicks.

Thanks!
bors d+

Final set of nitpicks.

Thanks!
bors d+

```suggestion
theorem ofUpperSet_le_iff {a b : WithUpperSetTopology Î±} : ofUpperSet a â‰¤ ofUpperSet b â†” a â‰¤ b :=
```

```suggestion
theorem toUpperSet_le_iff {a b : Î±} : toUpperSet a â‰¤ toUpperSet b â†” a â‰¤ b :=
```

```suggestion
/-- `ofUpper` as an `OrderIso` -/
def ofUpperSetOrderIso : OrderIso (WithUpperSetTopology Î±) Î± :=
{ toFun := ofUpperSet,
  invFun := toUpperSet,
  left_inv := toUpperSet_ofUpperSet,
  right_inv := ofUpperSet_toUpperSet,
  map_rel_iff' := ofUpperSet_le_iff }
```

```suggestion
/-- `toUpper` as an `OrderIso` -/
def toUpperSetOrderIso : OrderIso Î± (WithUpperSetTopology Î±) := 
{ toFun := toUpperSet,
  invFun := ofUpperSet,
  left_inv := ofUpperSet_toUpperSet,
  right_inv := toUpperSet_ofUpperSet,
  map_rel_iff' := toUpperSet_le_iff }
```

```suggestion
    (hf : Monotone f) : coinduced f tâ‚ â‰¤ upperSetTopology' Î² := by
```
The new convention is that everything before the `:=` has to be indented twice. Could you also check that in the rest of the file?

Presumably this only applies when the statement of the result runs over multiple lines? e.g.
```
lemma Monotone_to_LowerTopology_Dual_Continuous [TopologicalSpace Î±]
  [UpperSetTopology Î±] [TopologicalSpace Î²] [LowerTopology Î²] {f : Î± â†’ Î²áµ’áµˆ} (hf : Monotone f) :
    Continuous f := by
  rw [continuous_def]
```

No from what I understand the hypotheses and the statement have the same level of indentation, you only go back one tab when getting into the proof. So that gives:
```lean
lemma Monotone_to_LowerTopology_Dual_Continuous [TopologicalSpace Î±]
    [UpperSetTopology Î±] [TopologicalSpace Î²] [LowerTopology Î²] {f : Î± â†’ Î²áµ’áµˆ} (hf : Monotone f) :
    Continuous f := by
  rw [continuous_def]
```
Hopefully I've got this correct now?
Yes that's perfect, thanks!

This may bite us back at some point, but what do you think of just calling that `upperSetTopology` (with a small `u`) and using the case variation to distinguish it from `UpperSetTopology`. If you think that will be annoying I have no problem with keeping the current name.

I find having `upperSetTopology'`, `UpperSetTopology` and `WithUpperSetTopology` a bit confusing. Originally I tried not naming `upperSetTopology'` at all, but found I seemed to keep needing to refer to it.
I think it makes sense to have all three (see my comments on Zulip), as long as you are a bit careful about how you build up the API. The current naming is fine, so do whatever you prefer.
Is there a particular reason you split out this result from the TFAE? Ease of use for defining the Scott topology?

I think I used it in that form here: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/2508/files#diff-983e16dd03108ad09234625f776ad94cfb58b1f6ee4762bf7519306fd90a2b46R220

To be honest, I'm finding multiple topologies on the same space in Lean very hard to wrap my head around. Given that it's a very common situation in mathematics (think about all the topologies on a W*-algebra - e.g. Takesaki, Theory of Operator Algebra I Chapter II Theorem 2.6) I was hoping there might be more by the way of an established convention about how to set these things out. I asked [on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Multiple.20topologies.3F) but found it hard to interpret the answers.

I didn't participate in this thread at the time because I was busy with other things, but it's true that the discussion wasn't super clear. I have quite a lot of experience working with multiple topologies (although not in the context of order-related topologies). I'll try to write a summary of the way I see things tomorrow and post it on Zulip. 

I also have ideas about this particular situation, but I need to test them so I'll comment tomorrow.
I've added some explanations on Zulip, I hope that'll help to clarify things!

I would suggest doing the following:
```suggestion
protected lemma monotone_iff_continuous {tâ‚ : TopologicalSpace Î±} [UpperSetTopology Î±]
    {tâ‚‚ : TopologicalSpace Î²} [UpperSetTopology Î²] {f : Î± â†’ Î²} :
    Monotone f â†” Continuous f := by
  constructor
  Â· intro hf
    simp_rw [continuous_def, IsOpen_iff_IsUpperSet]
    exact fun _ hs â†¦ IsUpperSet.preimage hs hf
  Â· intro hf a b hab
    rw [â† mem_Iic, â† closure_singleton, â† mem_preimage]
    apply (Continuous.closure_preimage_subset hf {f b})
    rw [â† mem_Iic, â† closure_singleton] at hab
    apply mem_of_mem_of_subset hab
    apply closure_mono
    rw [singleton_subset_iff, mem_preimage, mem_singleton_iff]
```
I don't think the `coinduced` and `induced` statements are worth putting in the TFAE because they are always one rewrite away anyways, and I feel like `rw [UpperSetTopology.monotone_iff_continuous, continuous_iff_coinduced_le]` is more readable than `rw [(UpperSetTopology.monotone_tfae).out 0 2]`.

Then you can also remove `upperSetTopology_coinduced` imo, first because it can easily be proven;
```lean
lemma upperSetTopology_coinduced {tâ‚ : TopologicalSpace Î±} [UpperSetTopology Î±]
    (hf : Monotone f) : coinduced f tâ‚ â‰¤ upperSetTopology' Î² := by
  rwa [â† continuous_iff_coinduced_le, â† UpperSetTopology.monotone_iff_continuous]
```
and also because I think you can just work around it in #2508

```suggestion

/--
```
Did you try getting this proof by duality? For the shorter one above there's no point since it's really short already, but for this one and the ones below it would be really nice.
I've done this now. Needed an extra lemma: #6157

```suggestion
{ ofUpperSet with
  map_rel_iff' := ofUpperSet_le_iff }
```

```suggestion
{ toUpperSet with
  map_rel_iff' := toUpperSet_le_iff }
```

```suggestion
{ ofLowerSet with
  map_rel_iff' := ofLowerSet_le_iff }
```

```suggestion
{ toLowerSet with
  map_rel_iff' := toLowerSet_le_iff }
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [IsOpen_iff_IsUpperSet] at *
  apply isUpperSet_sInter
  intros s hs
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [IsOpen_iff_IsUpperSet] at *
  apply isUpperSet_iInter
  intros i
```

Untested
```suggestion
    rw [â† mem_Iic, â† closure_singleton, â† mem_preimage] at hab âŠ¢
    apply (Continuous.closure_preimage_subset hf {f b})
```

Not quite, but this works:
```
    rw [â† mem_Iic, â† closure_singleton] at hab âŠ¢
    apply (Continuous.closure_preimage_subset hf {f b})
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Order/UpperLowerSetTopology): Introduce the Upper Set (or Alexandrov) topology and the Lower Set topology
